subject: Re: [junit] Junit & CORBA
msgSnippet: ... How might tests without JUnit be different from tests with JUnit? JUnit is simply a framework for running tests regardless of how the test is implemented.
messageBody:
Ty Paywa wrote:

>Has anybody developed tests with Junit in a CORBA
>environment? The code I am testing uses CORBA
>extensively and I was wondering if I should even go
>down the path of using Junit or just develop tests
>without junit.
>
>

How might tests without JUnit be different from tests with JUnit?

JUnit is simply a framework for running tests regardless of how the test
is implemented. I haven't used CORBA in what feels like many moons, but
I'd start writing tests with JUnit rather than building my own automated
test runner. Then again, I'm lazy that way.

Mike
